title: CASPAR Criteria for Psoriatic Arthritis
description: Provides standardized classification criteria for identifying psoriatic arthritis (PsA) in patients with inflammatory arthritis. Requires presence of inflammatory articular disease plus ≥3 points from additional criteria.

parameters.name: inflammatory_articular_disease
parameters.description: Presence of inflammatory articular disease (joint, spine, or entheseal) - MANDATORY CRITERION

parameters.name: nail_dystrophy
parameters.description: Nail dystrophy: onycholysis, pitting, or hyperkeratosis on examination

parameters.name: rheumatoid_factor
parameters.description: Rheumatoid factor status (preferred: ELISA or nephelometry)

parameters.name: dactylitis
parameters.description: Dactylitis: current or historical swelling of entire digit

parameters.name: juxta_articular_new_bone
parameters.description: Juxtaarticular new bone formation: ill-defined ossification near joint margins on X-ray

result.name: caspar_classification
result.description: CASPAR classification result with total points and interpretation

ranges.description: Insufficient criteria for psoriatic arthritis classification
ranges.interpretation: Patient does not meet CASPAR criteria for psoriatic arthritis classification. <3 points from additional criteria or lacks mandatory inflammatory articular disease. Consider alternative diagnoses or further evaluation.

ranges.description: Meets criteria for psoriatic arthritis classification
ranges.interpretation: Patient meets CASPAR criteria for psoriatic arthritis classification. Presence of inflammatory articular disease plus ≥3 points from additional criteria supports PsA classification for research purposes.

references: Taylor W, Gladman D, Helliwell P, Marchesoni A, Mease P, Mielants H; CASPAR Study Group. Classification criteria for psoriatic arthritis: development of new criteria from a large international study. Arthritis Rheum. 2006 Aug;54(8):2665-73. doi: 10.1002/art.21972.
Chandran V, Schentag CT, Gladman DD. Sensitivity and specificity of the CASPAR criteria for psoriatic arthritis in a family medicine clinic setting. J Rheumatol. 2008 Oct;35(10):2069-70.
Helliwell PS, Taylor WJ. Classification and diagnostic criteria for psoriatic arthritis. Ann Rheum Dis. 2005 Mar;64 Suppl 2(Suppl 2):ii3-8. doi: 10.1136/ard.2004.032318.
formula: CASPAR Classification requires: 1) Inflammatory articular disease (mandatory) PLUS 2) ≥3 points from: Current psoriasis (2 pts), History of psoriasis (1 pt), Nail dystrophy (1 pt), RF negative (1 pt), Dactylitis (1 pt), Juxtaarticular new bone formation (1 pt)
notes: CASPAR criteria are classification criteria, not diagnostic criteria
Designed primarily for research and clinical trial patient selection
Requires mandatory presence of inflammatory articular disease
Current psoriasis scores 2 points; all other features score 1 point
Developed from international study of 588 PsA patients across 30 clinics
Personal or family history of psoriasis counts as 1 point (if no current psoriasis)
Nail dystrophy includes onycholysis, pitting, and hyperkeratosis
Dactylitis can be current or historical
Juxtaarticular new bone formation seen on X-ray of hands or feet
RF negativity preferred by ELISA or nephelometry methods
Should be used in conjunction with clinical judgment
Not intended as standalone diagnostic tool for individual patients
